text: One can be a brother only in something. Where there is no tie that binds men, men are not united but merely lined up.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Men judge us by the success of our efforts. God looks at the efforts themselves.
author: Charlotte Bronte

text: Only the unknown frightens men. But once a man has faced the unknown, that terror becomes the known.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: The 'morality of compromise' sounds contradictory. Compromise is usually a sign of weakness, or an admission of defeat. Strong men don't compromise, it is said, and principles should never be compromised.
author: Andrew Carnegie

text: Men do not understand books until they have a certain amount of life, or at any rate no man understands a deep book, until he has seen and lived at least part of its contents.
author: Ezra Pound
